sentence.Network_en: I tended to mistrust my emotions and intellectualize everything.
sentence.Network_cn: 我往往不相信自己的情感，倾向于把一切事物都理智化。

sentence.Network_en: They expressed deep mistrust of the paper promises.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们对书面承诺表现出极度的不信任。

sentence.Network_en: There remains deep mistrust of his government.
sentence.Network_cn: 仍然有人对他领导的政府很不信任。

list.abs: She have a deep mistrust of anything new or strange ., 她对任何新奇事物皆十分怀疑.

entry.def: Mistrust is the feeling that you have towards someone who you do not trust.

example.ex: There was mutual mistrust between the two men.

example.tran: 对国家银行的极端不信任

entry.def: If you mistrust someone or something, you do not trust them.

example.ex: It frequently appears that Bell mistrusts all journalists.
example.tran: 似乎贝尔常常对所有新闻记者都持怀疑态度。

means.word_mean: 2. the trait of not trusting others
1. regard as untrustworthy; regard with suspicion; have no faith or confidence in

sentences.en: She mistrusted her ability to learn to drive.
sentences.cn: 她不相信自己有开车的能力。

sentences.en: Please don’t think I mistrust you,but I would prefer to have our agreement in black and white.
sentences.cn: 请别以为我不相信你们,不过,我还是认为我们应把协议写成书面形式为好。

sentences.en: His experience left him with a mistrust of banks.
sentences.cn: 他的经历使他不信任银行。

sentences.en: Mistrust was writ large on her face.
sentences.cn: 她脸上明显流露出不信任的表情。
